cab.content: It is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document. -SECRET. 'W.P.(G)(40)87.19TH MARCH, 1940.WAR CABINET.SUGGESTED ANGLO-FRENCH DECLARATION NOT TO"""""CONCLUDE A SEPARATE PEACE.Note by the- Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs.copy NO.73.In connexion with my Paper W.P.(G)(40)86 I havebeen asked by the Chancellor of the Exchequer to suggestthat the original draft declaration set out in paragraph 2of the memorandum in W.P.(G)(40)86 should be strengthened by the insertion9 after the words "French Republic"s of the:words "being equally determined to carry on the war withthe utmost vigour until the purposes for which it was undertaken are attained".I should like to support this suggestion.(Intld.) H.foreign Office., S.W..1.TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND KEY.
